Package com.mainPack.froggerGameObjects

Class Animal

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.image.ImageView
        • com.mainPack.froggerGameObjects.Actor
          • com.mainPack.froggerGameObjects.Animal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    public class Animal
extends Actor
    Creates and positions the frog and checks the state of the game as the frog moves throughout the game until the number of ends = 5 or the frog lives have run out

      Boolean to store true or false if frog is killed by obstacles

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Animal​(java.lang.String imageLink)
      Sets the position of the frog as well as the images of the frog once it is in different positions depending on the keys pressed and released

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void act​(long now)
      Sets the position of the frog and checks the frogs position throughout the game and changes its image depending on whether it is hit by an obstacle or dies in the water and also checks whether the end is full and if so does not allow the frog to go into the end that has already been activated
      void addPoints​(int points)
      Adds the number of points passed into the function to the overall number of points and sets the changeScore variable to true to indicate a new score
      boolean changeScore()  
      void customDesign()
      Function to call the CSS file and make the design of alerts appear as specified in the CSS file
      int getFrogLives()
      Returns the number of frogLives
      int getPoints()
      Returns the points
      boolean getStop()
      Returns true or false to end the game based on whether the game is finished or the number of lives of the frog reached equals zero.
      boolean isCarDeath()
      Returns whether carDeath is true or false
      boolean isWaterDeath()
      Returns whether waterDeath is true or false
      int minusFroggerLife()
      If frogger lives is 0 then calls getStop() to end the game otherwise returns frogLives after it has been decremented by 1
      void minusPoints​(int points)
      Removes the number of points passed into the function from the overall number of points the and sets the changeScore variable to indicate a score change.
      void roundPoints​(int endPoints, java.util.ArrayList roundPoints)
      Prints the score the user achieved for the round and displays the score of each round in the game in descending order (Highest to lowest)
      int scoreForRound()
      Finds out the score earned for the round that the user is playing, sees how it has changed compared to the overall score of the last round and returns it for the user to see
      void setPoints​(int points)
      Sets the number of points the user has
